summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene is identified as an analyte whose rejection efficiency in reverse osmosis (RO) membranes is evaluated. The study reports that 1,4-dichlorobenzene has a rejection efficiency of 87%, indicating its significance as a target analyte in assessing the performance of RO membranes for volatile organic compounds (VOCs). The relationship is established through quantitative data on rejection rates, highlighting the importance of 1,4-dichlorobenzene in the context of VOC removal processes.
